xpack.uptime.certs.list.empty: No Certificates found. Note: Certificates are only visible for Heartbeat 7.8+

xpack.uptime.certs.status.ok.label.comment: Denotes an amount of time for which a cert is valid. Example: "OK for 2 days"

xpack.uptime.createPackagePolicy.stepCon: PEM formatted certificate for TLS client authentication.
PEM formatted certificate key for TLS client authentication.
Certificate key passphrase for TLS client authentication.
Verifies that the provided certificate is signed by a trusted authority (CA), but does not perform any hostname verification.
Verifies that the provided certificate is signed by a trusted authority (CA) and also verifies that the server’s hostname (or IP address) matches the names identified within the certificate.

Performs no verification of the server’s certificate. It is primarily intended as a temporary diagnostic mechanism when attempting to resolve TLS errors; its use in production environments is strongly discouraged.

Verifies that the provided certificate is signed by a trusted authority (CA) and also verifies that the server’s hostname (or IP address) matches the names identified within the certificate. If the Subject Alternative Name is empty, it returns an error.
This mode disables many of the security benefits of SSL/TLS and should only be used after cautious consideration.
Select one or more TLS protocols.
Controls the indexing of the HTTP response body contents to
Controls the indexing of the HTTP response headers to
Configure an optional request to send to the remote host including method, body, and headers.
Header key must be a valid HTTP token.
A dictionary of additional HTTP headers to send. By default the client will set the User-Agent header to identify itself.
A list of regular expressions to match the the body output negatively. Press enter to add a new expression. Return match failed if single expression matches.
A list of regular expressions to match the body output. Press enter to add a new expression. Only a single expression needs to match.
Check response body does not contain
Status code must contain digits only.
A list of expected status codes. Press enter to add a new code. 4xx and 5xx codes are considered down by default. Other codes are considered up.
Control the indexing of the HTTP response contents.
Header key must be a valid HTTP token.
A list of expected response headers.
APM service name for this monitor. Corresponds to the service.name ECS field. Set this when monitoring an app that is also using APM to enable integrations between Uptime and APM data in Kibana.
Max redirects must be 0 or greater
The total number of redirections to follow.
Password for authenticating with the server.
The URL of the SOCKS5 proxy to use when connecting to the server. The value must be a URL with a scheme of socks5://.
A list of tags that will be sent with the monitor event. Press enter to add a new tab. Displayed in Uptime and enables searching by tag.
Timeout must be 0 or greater and less than schedule interval
The total time allowed for testing the connection and exchanging data.
Username for authenticating with the server.
The duration to wait before emitting another ICMP Echo Request if no response is received.
Configure your monitor with the following options.
Configure the payload sent to the remote host.
A payload string to send to the remote host.
Configure the expected response from the remote host.
Configure TLS options, including verification mode, certificate authorities, and client certificates.

xpack.uptime.locationName.helpLinkAnnota.comment: Text that instructs the user to navigate to our docs to add a geographic location to their data

xpack.uptime.ml.enableAnomalyDetectionPa:
Here you can create a machine learning job to calculate anomaly scores on
    response durations for Uptime Monitor. Once enabled, the monitor duration chart on the details page
    will show the expected bounds and annotate the graph with anomalies. You can also potentially
     identify periods of increased latency across geographical regions.
You can enable anomaly detection job or if job is already there you can manage the job or alert.
The analysis is now running for response duration chart. It might take a while before results are added to the response times graph.
Your current license may not allow for creating machine learning jobs, or this job may already exist.
Once a job is created, you can manage it and see more details in the {mlJobsPageLink}.
Note: It might take a few minutes for the job to begin calculating results.
In order to access duration anomaly detection, you have to be subscribed to an Elastic Platinum license.

xpack.uptime.overview.pageHeader.synthet: Uptime is now previewing support for scripted multi-step availability checks. This means you can interact with elements of a webpage and check the availability of an entire journey (such as making a purchase or signing into a system) instead of just a simple single page up/down check. Please click below to read more and, if you'd like to be one of the first to use these capabilities, you can download our preview synthetics agent and view your synthetic checks in Uptime.
